section: 2.10 Control. Control (including the terms Controlling and Controlled by) of a Person shall mean (i) holding fifty percent (50%) or more ownership or beneficial interest of income and capital of such Person or (ii) having ownership of at least fifty percent (50%)
explanation: The definition of control is ambiguous because it includes ownership of 50% of income and capital or ownership of 50% of voting power, implying that these could be different. It's unclear if 'or' is meant to create separate conditions or if both must be met. The last condition says regardless of the percentage ownership interest held. This section contains contradiction in legal terms.

section: Any amounts payable (including any recoupment claims or other amounts to be reimbursed) by Vendor or its Affiliates to AT&T or its Affiliates under this Agreement (including under the Build Addendum or the Maintenance Addendum) may be offset against the Maintenance Fees or any payment due or to become due to Vendor or its Affiliates under the Transport Agreement, Master License Agreement provided, however, that AT&Ts offset right under this Section 3.22 shall not apply to any Structured Payments for any Cell Site that has reached Location Acceptance and AT&T hereby waives all such rights of setoff and recoupment against such Structured Payments.
explanation: This section is inconsistent in the text. At first it says that any ammounts payable by the vendor to AT&T may be offset. Then it states that AT&T offset right shall not apply to any structured payments. This contradicts what was stated at the beggining of the section.

section:
2.18 Excusable Delay. Excusable Delay means a delay in Vendors performance or obligations with respect to any Cell Site past any scheduled Delivery Date or Completion Date (including any scheduled Completion Date for a Milestone, scheduled Completion Date for Location Acceptance or scheduled Phase Completion Date set forth in the Build Addendum) that is caused by any of the following events:
(d) AT&Ts failure to deliver the AT&T Provided Equipment (as such term is defined in the Build Addendum) within sixty (60) days prior to the applicable Phase Completion Date for such Cell Site
explanation: The text says that the excusable delay happens when ATT fails to deliver equipment 60 days prior, this does not make sense because it is impossible to fail 60 days prior. This is an example of structural flaw in text.
